title: Experimental Development of Mathematics Pedagogy for Military Team Training Design

context.prior_knowledge: Basic instructional design theory, foundational understanding of team dynamics, basic statistical and probability concepts
context.additional_context: Requires designing learning activities focused on smartphones in limited-technology environments. Applies advanced mathematical domains (linear programming, graph theory, probability modeling) for secondary-level adult learners.

learning_goals: Learners can identify and apply core team competency elements (communication, problem-solving, resource management) using mathematical modeling when designing team training scenarios.
Learners can perform team task analysis processes with over 80% accuracy using experiment-based data analysis (statistical validation, probabilistic modeling).

Learners can develop a team training evaluation tool prototype (mathematical assessment scale) in a blended environment using limited technologies (two online collaboration tools, one offline material) and propose a plan to achieve 4/5 or higher in four out of five peer evaluation rubric items.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
